meanings.definition: To kill or destroy excessively or to an unnecessary extent.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was overkilling the weeds in his garden by using too much pesticide.
meanings.sent2: The company risked overkilling their budget by spending too much on unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overkilled the dish with too much salt, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: Her strict diet was overkilling her enjoyment of food, turning meals into a chore.
meanings.sent5: The detective's relentless questioning was overkilling the suspect's patience.

meanings.definition: The act of killing or destroying excessively or to an unnecessary extent.
meanings.sent1: The forest fire was an example of overkilling of the natural habitat.
meanings.sent2: The overkilling of fish in the lake led to an imbalance in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The overkilling of jokes at the party made everyone groan instead of laugh.
meanings.sent4: The overkilling of decorations in the room made it look cluttered and chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The overkilling of details in the report made it difficult to find the main points.
